files.patch:
@@ -34,0 +34,11 @@
+// Macro to check if Apple memory tagging is available
+#ifdef __APPLE__
+#if defined(VM_MAKE_TAG) && defined(VM_MEMORY_JAVA)
+#define APPLE_MEMORY_TAGGING_AVAILABLE 1
+#else
+#define APPLE_MEMORY_TAGGING_AVAILABLE 0
+#endif
+#else
+#define APPLE_MEMORY_TAGGING_AVAILABLE 0
+#endif
+
@@ -38,1 +49,1 @@
-#if defined(__APPLE__) && defined(VM_MAKE_TAG) && defined(VM_MEMORY_JAVA)
+#if APPLE_MEMORY_TAGGING_AVAILABLE

@@ -40,0 +40,1 @@
+#include "os_bsd.hpp"
@@ -1199,3 +1200,1 @@
-#if defined(__APPLE__) && defined(VM_MAKE_TAG) && defined(VM_MEMORY_JAVA)
-// Test that JVM-allocated memory is properly tagged with VM_MEMORY_JAVA on macOS
-// for proper memory accounting and debugging capabilities.
+#if APPLE_MEMORY_TAGGING_AVAILABLE
@@ -1217,1 +1216,1 @@
-#endif // defined(__APPLE__) && defined(VM_MAKE_TAG) && defined(VM_MEMORY_JAVA)
+#endif // APPLE_MEMORY_TAGGING_AVAILABLE

@@ -32,0 +32,2 @@
+#include "os_bsd.hpp"
+
@@ -70,1 +72,1 @@
-#ifdef __APPLE__
+#if APPLE_MEMORY_TAGGING_AVAILABLE
@@ -94,1 +96,0 @@
-    // Check if the user_tag matches VM_MEMORY_JAVA
@@ -100,1 +101,1 @@
-#endif
+#endif // APPLE_MEMORY_TAGGING_AVAILABLE

@@ -54,1 +54,0 @@
-  // This function is used by multiple test files to validate BSD memory tagging
